<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 274 <sup>1.1</sup>, [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 121 <sup>2.0</sup>, [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 27 <sup>2.0</sup>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) Characters from Mwangi Expanse have access to this option_

**Favored Weapon** [Bes](/Deities.aspx?ID=633)

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 6 sp

**Damage** 1d6 S

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Type** Melee

**Category** Martial

**Group** [Axe](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=1)
</row>

</column>

---

Also known as a hunga munga or danisco, this knife-axe hybrid consists of a hilt and blade that curves backward toward the wielder. The blade’s curve is such that, after a mambele has struck a victim, more damage is dealt as the weapon is extracted from the victim’s body.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).
